On Wed, Apr 4, 2012 at 1:16 PM, Markus Lanthaler
<markus.lanthaler@...>wrote:

> We went even so far to formally
> define what define Linked Data is in the context of JSON-LD [2].
>
>
Careful, the next stumbling block, once people run out of steam on NIR/IR,
is serialisation.

Before anyone should give a damn about serialising IRs, and publishing
NIRs, you have to grok that what RDF actually is is a directed graph model,
just like the web, where relationships are disambiguated with
URI-identified, reusable properties.

Therefore that descriptions are uniformly made with these properties, in
RDF triples (specifying which property relates which resource to which
other resource), not spread across centralised semi-standardised link
relations and non-reused ambiguous relations in tree-like data models
(JSON, XML, etc.)

That's where the discussion should surely focus, not on range14 and
serialisation. These are side issues.

Barry

--20cf306f7d1ac4793304bcd98509
